Articles.Content: I am having issues with loading KSP I will be stuck on the loading screen and a file from a mod will not load I tried removing that mod and the Issue continued with another a tried removing that mod but the problem only continued.

2 hours ago, _Leo_Pard_ said:

I am having issues

Is this what I need?

https://www.dropbox.com/s/zfmjr4q7ghbb4vh/KSP.zip?dl=0

3 hours ago, _Leo_Pard_ said:

Is this what I need?

Indeed, logs are the thing.

As for your problems, a cursory (on mobile atm) look at your log suggests that you are running several mods that are not compatible with KSP 1.9.1. Firespitter an WildBlueTools at the least are clearly broken.

Removing all instances of miniavc.dll (or installing zerominiavc) would also be wise, It was horribly broken recently and I don't know if it's been fixed yet.

Check all your mods are up to date and compatible, then search your log for "exception" to spot any remainiing borkage. If that doesn't fix it I'll have a better look later - when I have a non-miniscule screen to look with. @ or quote me when replying so I get a notification.

 

Edited March 16, 2020 by steve_v

2 hours ago, steve_v said:

As for your problems, a cursory (on mobile atm) look at your log suggests that you are running several mods that are not compatible with KSP 1.9.1. Firespitter an WildBlueTools at the least are clearly broken.

Check all your mods are up to date and compatible, then search your log for "exception" to spot any remainiing borkage. If that doesn't fix it I'll have a better look later - when I have a non-miniscule screen to look with. @ or quote me when replying so I get a notification.

 

So I tried reinstalling Firespitter and I tried removing it completely, but that did not solve my issue, I know some of the the mods are not compatible with 1.9.1 but they are loading 

Also I not sure what to look for in spotting brokage

15 minutes ago, _Leo_Pard_ said:

So I tried reinstalling Firespitter and I tried removing it completely, but that did not solve my issue

So what about wildblue and miniavc?

16 minutes ago, _Leo_Pard_ said:

I know some of the the mods are not compatible with 1.9.1 but they are loading

If the game doesn't load correctly, how would you know?

How about removing all those incompatible mods? It's step _one_ in troubleshooting after all...

19 minutes ago, _Leo_Pard_ said:

I not sure what to look for in spotting brokage

I just told you what to look for, exceptions in the log.

Loading screen hints for a given mods parts mean nothing WRT whether or not a plugin has loaded correctly, the only way to know that is by looking in the log file. If you want to try using incompatible mods, you're going to have to learn to do this.

1 hour ago, steve_v said:

So what about wildblue and miniavc?

I removed both of those and still the problem continued

 

If the game doesn't load correctly, how would you know?

How about removing all those incompatible mods? It's step _one_ in troubleshooting after all...

I can try but I don't think thats the problem i did a test with only some of the mods and KSP loaded fine then even with some of the incompatible mods

 

I just told you what to look for, exceptions in the log.

Loading screen hints for a given mods parts mean nothing WRT whether or not a plugin has loaded correctly, the only way to know that is by looking in the log file. If you want to try using incompatible mods, you're going to have to learn to do this.

8 minutes ago, _Leo_Pard_ said:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/n8nqok1zcnteawc/KSP.zip?dl=0

Alright then, one last time before I get bored with this runaround:

The version of Firespitter you have (had?) installed is ancient and broken with KSP 1.9.1. It's also not installed correctly, being in GameData rather than in it's correct subdirectory.
Why is this: 

Firespitter.dll
Firespitter.dll - Shortcut.lnk

Sitting in GameData? Is it truly gone now?

If you have actually updated firespitter to a working version (7.15 IIRC), please link a fresh log without all the mess it is causing. And please check that all your mods up to date, as suggested in the support sticky I linked right at the beginning of this ordeal.


If mods you want to run have no update for the KSP version you are using, test them one at a time in a clean install, and look at the log produced to make sure they are not throwing any exceptions. Some of the stuff you have installed hasn't been updated for over two years... Expecting not to have problems with a setup like this is madness.
